oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three-page handwritten letter from Ammons at Lai Khe Base Camp to his family describing his assignment to the 3rd Platoon as a Rifleman. He will be carrying the M79 grenade launcher, two Claymore mines, trip flares, grenades, and a .45 caliber pistol. Ammons also divulges that he attended church and memorial services for two recently killed platoon members. He mentions that his anticipated date to leave Vietnam is November 5, 1968.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher D. Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia in 1948. He enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, and served with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. He served two tours in Vietnam, 1967-1968 and 1969-1970.
